name: Unity
description: A versatile game engine known for its ease of use and cross-platform support, widely used for mobile, indie, and AAA games.

name: Unreal Engine
description: A high-end game engine offering stunning graphics, real-time rendering, and Blueprints for visual scripting.

name: Godot
description: An open-source game engine with a lightweight design and strong support for 2D and 3D development.

name: C++
description: A powerful language used in high-performance game engines like Unreal Engine, offering direct hardware access and efficiency.

name: C#
description: The primary language for Unity development, balancing performance and ease of use.

name: JavaScript
description: Used for browser-based and web games, often with libraries like Phaser and Three.js.

name: Python
description: Used for AI scripting, automation, and game prototypes due to its simplicity and flexibility.

name: Blender
description: A free and open-source 3D modeling and animation tool with powerful sculpting, rendering, and texturing capabilities.

name: Maya
description: An industry-standard 3D modeling and animation software used for cinematic animations and character rigging.

name: Photoshop
description: A leading software for creating textures, UI elements, and concept art in game development.
